Fantastic idea! Korean-style BBQ is always a hit, and offering vegetarian options will ensure that all your guests can enjoy the flavors of Korea. Here are some delicious Korean-style BBQ vegetarian options you could serve alongside bulgogi and galbi:

**1. Vegetarian Bulgogi (Deodeok Bulgogi)**: Replace the beef with deodeok (Korean bellflower roots) or mushrooms, and marinate them in a sweet and savory bulgogi sauce.

**2. Grilled Tofu Bokkeum ():** Marinate extra-firm tofu in a Korean-inspired sauce (e.g., gochujang, soy sauce, garlic, ginger, sugar) and grill it until crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.

**3. Vegetable Skewers (Yachae Gohyang-yi):** Alternate vegetables like cherry tomatoes, mushrooms, bell peppers, onions, and zucchini on skewers and brush with a Korean-style BBQ sauce (e.g., gochujang, soy sauce, garlic, sugar).

**4. Grilled Portobello Mushrooms (Beoseot Bulgogi):** Marinate sliced portobello mushrooms in a bulgogi sauce and grill them until tender and flavorful.

**5. Zucchini Fritters (Hobak Jun):** Shred zucchini and mix it with Korean chili flakes, garlic, ginger, and flour. Form into patties and grill until crispy and golden.

**6. Grilled Eggplant (Gaji Bokkeum):** Slice eggplant into thick rounds, brush with oil, and grill until tender. Brush with a Korean-style BBQ sauce during the last minute of grilling.

**7. Vegetable Japchae ():** Stir-fry a variety of vegetables (e.g., spinach, carrots, bell peppers, onions) with sweet potato starch noodles and a sweet and savory soy-based sauce. Serve as a side dish or add to the grill for a few minutes to give it a smoky flavor.

**8. Korean-Style Grilled Tofu Tacos (Dubu Tacos):** Marinate extra-firm tofu in a Korean-inspired sauce and grill it until crispy. Serve in tacos with kimchi slaw, cilantro, and a drizzle of gochujang.

These vegetarian Korean-style BBQ options will complement your bulgogi and galbi perfectly and offer a delicious and flavorful experience for your guests. Enjoy!
